pathAssistantSteps.info:
Learn about and contact your new referral quickly.


Use Salesforce referrals to separate potential customers from existing customer's you already know.


Respond to your referral within five days to increase your chances of converting the referral record to an opportunity. 

  • Review your referral's description and expressed interest to understand the customer's needs.
  • Connect with the referrer to extract more information about the prospect if appropriate.

Nurture your referral so that you’re top-of-mind.


Send emails based on time intervals and your referrals’ actions. Nurturing referrals helps to free up time to focus on other opportunities in your pipeline.

  • Assign a rating to your referral based on what you’ve learned during the qualification process.
  • Before you mark your referral Unqualified, schedule six follow-up tasks to email or call your referral.

Congratulations! Now it’s time to convert the referral record to an opportunity. Then, continue the qualification process with your new contact.


To prevent creating duplicate accounts, search for existing account first.

If your referral has neither the interest nor the authority to purchase from you, mark the referral as Unqualified. 


Don’t waste time on unqualified referrals.

  • Learn about the referral source before you spend time selling them a product they're not ready for.
  • Determine whether referral is likely to buy from you.

Verify contact information and qualify your referral.


Gather as much contact information as you can. Get tips from the pros about the importance of qualifying your referral.

  • Get your referral’s email address, phone number, and title so that you can include your referral in future campaigns.
  • Email your referral first, and immediately follow up with a phone call.
  • Rehearse your call scripts so that you sound confident and the flow of your conversation is more natural.
